data.title: Bruce Willis' wife urges fans to 'make time for some fun' amid husband's dementia battle
data.meta_description: Bruce Willis' wife Emma Heming Willis took to social media this weekend sharing an adorable clip with her mum reminding her followers to 'make time for some fun' amid her husband's health battle
data.text:
Bruce Willis' wife Emma Heming Willis sent out a sweet reminder to her fans this weekend to "make time for some fun" amid her husband's dementia battle.

On Friday night, Emma took to her Instagram Story sharing a sweet mother-daughter date night out with her mum Zorina Heming. In her post, the 45-year-old was seen spending some quality time with Zorina as they treated themselves to a delicious hibachi dinner at Benihana in front of a flaming grill.

In the short clip, Zorina was all smiles as Emma panned the camera over to her while an electric relaxation tune played in the background. Emma sweetly captioned the story: "Make time for some fun with your mommy at Benihana. It really never disappoints."

Emma's latest post comes as she continues to dedicate her time caring for her husband Bruce was he struggles with his ongoing battle with dementia. The beloved Die Hard actor was diagnosed with frontotemporal dementia (better known as FTD) last spring. His health battle was first announced the year prior when his family revealed he was suffering from a language disorder called aphasia.

Patients that suffer from the condition can experience a number of symptoms including unusual behaviours, emotional problems, trouble communicating, difficulty with work, or difficulty with walking, according to The National Institute on Aging.

His wife Emma, who he's been married to for 14 years, has been a steady rock for the actor throughout his heath battle, staying by his side every step of the way, while raising awareness to their fans. The couple share two kids together, welcoming Mabel in 2012 and Evelyn in 2014. Bruce also shares three older children with ex-wife Demi Moore including Rumer, Tallulah and Scout.

In March, Emma expressed her unconditional love for the retired Hollywood star in a heartfelt birthday post. In the post celebrating the Unbreakable star's 69th birthday, she gushed over their romance describing Bruce's arms the "safest place in this whole wide world". She went on to add that he was a true "gentleman" and was the "gift that keeps giving" and still has so much love to share and give to the world.
